body:
Testosterone=your life is ruined. Biologically, the purpose of male is sperm donor, provider and protector. Males have a collectivist function while females have a more individual one (counter-intuitive since females are much better at social interactions, but those are *private* interactions). So naturally, men get stuck with all the dirty jobs, the boredom, the propensity to be angry, the obligation to risk their lives and go through hell, the draft, not being allowed to have problems or emotions, the lack of natural talents and worse cognitive ability in exchange for the physical, the higher pain sensitivity, the ugliness, the 24/7 sex drive and hormones, all the responsibility, all the guilt, all the blame, the constant rage and depression, and pretty much everything bad. Females get a brain that specializes in personal functions, so they end up happy, talented, with brains that optimize for logic and creativity, better at almost everything, the good looks, the easy jobs, the far lower expectations, the permission to whine about the smallest things, the right to leech off of a man's labor, more career options (mostly due to having more biological talent), lower pain sensitivity, only having hormone issues once a month, the right to push all her problems on men, the emotional intelligence, and basically everything good. The ONLY advantages men have in an equal society are physical strength and not having to deal with a uterus. Almost everything else women have it 100% better. Men are the disposable sex, the modified form, the replaceable slaves, and the loss of a male is no big deal but the loss of a female is a tragedy. Think, 10 females and one male can have 10 pregnancies; but 1 female and 10 males can still only have one pregnancy. This is reflected in society: men, with all their other problems already, only have value in what they do; women are inherently priceless. Women and children first. And before you say anything, yes, everything, from your abilities to your happiness to your success, is almost completely determined by your genes.

And actually testosterone makes you overconfident and more stupid overall, and also more selfish and less capable of empathy or sympathy. Women have better decision making biologically. But similar to intelligence, the drastically higher expectations placed on men makes them seem better even though this isn't the case biologically; they have to manage it to survive. Women on the other hand are coddled and it is not frowned upon for them to act "emotional" and suppressing this is VERY hard without being coerced. The consequences for making mistakes are also much graver for men.

body: It's not bullshit. Me and every man I know suddenly became chronically unhappy at the onset of puberty for seemingly no reason, whether we admit it or not we're constantly filled with rage and depression to due our brain structure and hormones. We also lost our learning ability and creativity and basically every part of our childhood brilliance. However, the women do not have to experience either of these awful changes. It's just not seen as a big deal because no one gives a SHIT about mens' lives, only what they do on the outside. There are deeply rooted biological reasons for this grave unfairness. Male is the expendable sex that basically slaves for the female. As such our brains and bodies sacrifice everything about ourselves to be better at doing this. Yeah, sure sounds like men have a lot of privilege.

body: I've debunked this multiple times. It is true that males show greater variability but females also average far higher than them biologically speaking. The reason they don't in practice is because, like I said, they're coddled and held to MUCH lower expectations; and your brain will not grow if you don't use it. The fact that women maintain the same intelligence as men in this situation is very impressive. However, the few hard working women will make Sheldon Cooper and Albert Einstein feel like retards. The highest IQ on record is a female's, and we actually have one of these savant women on ruqqus (@sfrohne).

So naturally, men get stuck with all the dirty jobs, the boredom, the propensity to be angry, the obligation to risk their lives and go through hell, the draft, not being allowed to have problems or emotions, the lack of natural talents and worse cognitive ability in exchange for the physical, the higher pain sensitivity, the ugliness, the 24/7 sex drive and hormones, all the responsibility, all the guilt, all the blame, the constant rage and depression, and pretty much everything bad. Females get a brain that specializes in personal functions, so they end up happy, talented, with brains that optimize for logic and creativity, better at almost everything, the good looks, the easy jobs, the far lower expectations, the permission to whine about the smallest things, the right to leech off of a man's labor, more career options (mostly due to having more biological talent), lower pain sensitivity, only having hormone issues once a month, the right to push all her problems on men, the emotional intelligence, and basically everything good. The ONLY advantages men have in an equal society are physical strength and not having to deal with a uterus. Almost everything else women have it 100% better. Men are the disposable sex, the modified form, the replaceable slaves, and the loss of a male is no big deal but the loss of a female is a tragedy. Think, 10 females and one male can have 10 pregnancies; but 1 female and 10 males can still only have one pregnancy. This is reflected in society: men, with all their other problems already, only have value in what they do; women are inherently priceless. Women and children first. And before you say anything, yes, everything, from your abilities to your happiness to your success, is almost completely determined by your genes.

And actually testosterone makes you overconfident and more stupid overall, and also more selfish and less capable of empathy or sympathy. Women have better decision making biologically. But similar to intelligence, the drastically higher expectations placed on men makes them seem better even though this isn't the case biologically; they have to manage it to survive. Women on the other hand are coddled and it is not frowned upon for them to act "emotional" and suppressing this is VERY hard without being coerced. The consequences for making mistakes are also much graver for men.

body:
Being male does suck. But so does being born female, for different reasons. A woman's social value is equivalent to her sexual value. Accordingly, after menopause a woman pretty much loses all value to society whatsoever which is horribly cruel, and this process begins much earlier than that. I think most women are conscious of this fact. Meanwhile, being male, you always have *some* value to society. You are always prized if you can produce something meaningful and attain higher social status. It must be stated that this can also occur at almost any age for a man. 

So yes.. Men are disposable, cannot show vulnerability, receive zero affection, no one cares about you in the slightest, are regularly tormented by society for absolutely no reason, are blamed for all worldly issues, and generally have a miserable existence and are encouraged to kill themselves if they cannot stay solid under this overwhelming pressure.

But. I still think women have it worse. At least time isn't my enemy. At least my value isn't decided by something completely out of my control. At least I'm respected (or more often disrespected) for my identity, rather than my immutable characteristics.

body:
Not because they are protected by society. Its largely biology at play, which news flash, has little to no effect on our social norms.

"Women have two copies of the X chromosome in every cell, whereas men have one X and one Y chromosome. With women, if one of the genes on the X chromosome becomes faulty, they have a healthy ‘backup’ copy. Men, on the other hand, have to make do with any faulty genes on their single X chromosome, which can put them at a greater risk of disease.

From the moment they are a ball of cells, males are more vulnerable than females, with male babies at a 20 per cent greater risk of dying in the womb. But according to ageing expert Prof David Gems at University College London, mortality in men soars once puberty hits. Some of this is due to men’s more risky behaviour, but studies suggest that long-term problems are caused by the physical changes in the body created by the hormone testosterone.

A 2012 study of records from pre-19th-Century Korea showed that eunuchs who were castrated as boys before the testosterone surge of puberty, lived 14 to 19 years longer than their contemporaries.

With the life expectancy differences so tied up with hormones and genetics, it seems unlikely that men will ever close the gap entirely. But the good news is that not all of our ageing is predetermined. The Russian gap between the sexes, for instance, is thought to be due to the culture of heavy drinking and smoking. As cultures can change, it’s possible for both sexes to live healthier lives with the genetic hand they are dealt. Meanwhile, advances in our treatment of diseases should help us to close the gap even further."

"[...] the gender differential in life expectancy from birth is about 6.5 years greater for women in the U.S., 5.3 years in the UK, 12 years in Russia, and about 6 months in India. This societal diversity implies that social factors have an influence on male and female longevity. While women have a biological advantage, historically certain living conditions and social customs tended to negate this benefit. For example, iron deficiency anemia due to female blood loss contributed in the past to excess female mortality. Social differences between men and women and the challenges of motherhood have further compromised women’s biological advantage.

Female hormones, particularly estrogen, and the resiliency of the female body to accommodate pregnancy and breast-feeding are also thought to promote longevity. Estrogens have beneficial effects on lipids in the blood and seem to protect a woman from premature heart disease.

Male behaviors tend to be riskier, and more men are exposed to hazards in the workplace. Men experience more motor vehicle accidents and have higher rates of alcoholism and smoking. In addition, males tend to drive more aggressively than females, and men on average smoke more cigarettes and drink more alcohol than women. These excess risks in men tend to increase the likelihood of heart disease and malignancy.

The ways the genders relate to their bodies is another potential factor explaining male and female longevity differences. Women tend to be more health conscious and attend to their bodies, seeking preventive health care and practicing healthier lifestyles compared to men. Men relate to their bodies with strength and power and expose them to risks from early ages.

Another way to approach the longevity differential between women and men is to look at the causes of death across the life span. Graphs of mortality ratios by gender show excess male mortality by violence that peaks at 4:1 around age 30. Gender-specific mortality rates for the top 10 causes of death shows excess male-to-female ratio for all conditions except diabetes mellitus, for which the risk is identical. Whether this gender gap relates to biological differences or lifestyle choices such as cigarette smoking is a matter of debate. Perhaps diabetes in women somehow reduces the gender-specific advantage enjoyed by women for other diseases.

Nonetheless, the consequences of atherosclerosis clearly affect the longevity differential between men and women. Roughly speaking, if all atherosclerotic causes of death were immediately eliminated, the gender mortality gap would be cut in half."

**And I have to throw this in here because KEK!!**: "Of course, other social factors could also have an influence on gender longevity. The perception of temperature sometimes generates marital tensions. The topic came up at a medical conference on aging, and after the discussion, an elderly man told me, “It is perfectly clear why women outlive men: Their wives freeze them to death.”"

Graphs of mortality ratios by gender show excess male mortality by violence that peaks at 4:1 around age 30. Gender-specific mortality rates for the top 10 causes of death shows excess male-to-female ratio for all conditions except diabetes mellitus, for which the risk is identical. Whether this gender gap relates to biological differences or lifestyle choices such as cigarette smoking is a matter of debate. Perhaps diabetes in women somehow reduces the gender-specific advantage enjoyed by women for other diseases.

Nonetheless, the consequences of atherosclerosis clearly affect the longevity differential between men and women. Roughly speaking, if all atherosclerotic causes of death were immediately eliminated, the gender mortality gap would be cut in half."

And I have to throw this in here because KEK!!: "Of course, other social factors could also have an influence on gender longevity. The perception of temperature sometimes generates marital tensions. The topic came up at a medical conference on aging, and after the discussion, an elderly man told me, “It is perfectly clear why women outlive men: Their wives freeze them to death.”"

body:
Uh... You know, I don't know anything really about the ins and outs of American culture, so I will not comment on your experiences in that shit-hole country. However afaik men have never been seen as expendable as you like to make it seem. When they die it's *still* a 'tragedy', seen as a great loss so long as the man was cared for (family, friends, colleagues etc... (and not totally horrible, like a child molester). People weep for both genders. Always have, and always will. 

And I surely didn't mean to make it sound like we take something biological, say oak, and then make it a social norm that everyone who indulges in that culture likes that particular tree. That is at least the (incorrect assumption) thing you seem to have taken out of everything I relayed to you. 

Yes surely, it is based on biological differences at large, because that is what makes our behaviour; HOWEVER, why would we have a patriarchy instead of a matriarchy like orcas do? They're the least bit if not more intelligent than humans, so why don't we do like them? Our social norms were based on our very 'animalistic' nature back in the day, that was based on our biology. Nowadays however, it's based on being sedentary and bringing home those sweets sweet shekels. Computers aren't biology, they're not something we have evolved to have or even use, but they're still a social norm today.

body:
Not all behavior is biological, but our urges and instincts most definitely are, and those are the biggest influences on our behavior.

And I never said it's not a tragedy when a man dies, if they're someone close to you. However in the case where you don't know the person, experiments have proven that if a female is in trouble everyone will react and do whatever they can, whereas if a male is in distress he'll just be ignored or laughed at. Think about it, a crying girl needs cared for but a boy doing the same is just a whiny spoiled brat. It's called the "women are wonderful" effect, we're hardwired to be very empathetic towards females because they're so valuable, but the same is not true for the expendable males. You could say that this reduces the female's value down to her uterus, however this is true for both sexes as males are also reduced to sperm donors. What's important are the *side effects* of sexual function on every other aspect of life, and it seems the male ones are much more detrimental to personal life. This is because for us males, the more valuable organ lies within the other sex, and not ourselves, therefore we are designed to benefit the female, and so is she; neither sex is designed with the welfare of the male in mind, as there's always more males; the female is the important one. You may object and say this is only about sex and doesn't matter elsewhere, but since nearly every part of biology is optimized for sexual reproduction, this is a HUGE deal. It's not like there's some kind of conspiracy to make males miserable, it's just an unintended consequence of how nature works. I will not deny that there are miserable females, they may even make up the majority; however they at least have the *chance* to be happy, while males are pretty much hardwired to be miserable even if they're the luckiest person in history.

body:
The differences on those graphs are so tiny as to mean barely anything at all. Considering that boys are forced to work strenuously while the girls are coddled and tend to neglect their brain cells, it's actually pretty good evidence that the girls are smarter because they *still* match the boys in spite of this.

You can see clearly that female brains are designed for thinking whereas male brains are optimized more for physical skills (blue=male, orange=female): https://cdn.mos.cms.futurecdn.net/bPhYyqHPN6axRnn2F8emKR.jpg

The structure isn't even comparable and it's obvious that the female is more invested in conscious and cognitive areas of the brain while the males pay more attention to the cerebellum and motor skills. In males the two hemispheres can't even work together and they have FAR less attention devoted to mental function on either side! Considering the historical roles of each sex there's no reason to be surprised at this finding unless you just want to insist that female=bad-and-only-exists-to-be-fucked.

Also guess which chromosomes the world record IQ holder has?

The differences on those graphs are so tiny as to mean barely anything at all. Considering that boys are forced to work strenuously while the girls are coddled and tend to neglect their brain cells, it's actually pretty good evidence that the girls are smarter because they *still* match the boys in spite of this.

You can see clearly that female brains are designed for thinking whereas male brains are optimized more for physical skills (blue=male, orange=female): https://cdn.mos.cms.futurecdn.net/bPhYyqHPN6axRnn2F8emKR.jpg

The structure isn't even comparable and it's obvious that the female is more invested in conscious and cognitive areas of the brain while the males pay more attention to the cerebellum and motor skills. In males the two hemispheres can't even work together and they have FAR less attention devoted to mental function on either side! Considering the historical roles of each sex there's no reason to be surprised at this finding unless you just want to insist that female=bad-and-only-exists-to-be-fucked.

Also guess which chromosomes the world record IQ holder has?

parent.body:
Not all behavior is biological, but our urges and instincts most definitely are, and those are the biggest influences on our behavior.

And I never said it's not a tragedy when a man dies, if they're someone close to you. However in the case where you don't know the person, experiments have proven that if a female is in trouble everyone will react and do whatever they can, whereas if a male is in distress he'll just be ignored or laughed at. Think about it, a crying girl needs cared for but a boy doing the same is just a whiny spoiled brat. It's called the "women are wonderful" effect, we're hardwired to be very empathetic towards females because they're so valuable, but the same is not true for the expendable males. You could say that this reduces the female's value down to her uterus, however this is true for both sexes as males are also reduced to sperm donors. What's important are the *side effects* of sexual function on every other aspect of life, and it seems the male ones are much more detrimental to personal life. This is because for us males, the more valuable organ lies within the other sex, and not ourselves, therefore we are designed to benefit the female, and so is she; neither sex is designed with the welfare of the male in mind, as there's always more males; the female is the important one. You may object and say this is only about sex and doesn't matter elsewhere, but since nearly every part of biology is optimized for sexual reproduction, this is a HUGE deal. It's not like there's some kind of conspiracy to make males miserable, it's just an unintended consequence of how nature works. I will not deny that there are miserable females, they may even make up the majority; however they at least have the *chance* to be happy, while males are pretty much hardwired to be miserable even if they're the luckiest person in history.
